response.original_title: The Most Excellent Dying of Theodore Jack Heckelman
response.overview: The Most Excellent Dying of Theodore Jack Heckelman is a heartfelt documentary capturing the conscious, courageous journey of a man determined to live fully until his last days. Known for calling his dying “my last great adventure,” Jack is surrounded by family and community, with rare, intimate footage of his final moments. Highlights include his niece crafting his casket, friends singing and saying farewell, and a three-day home vigil. The film offers an open, accepting view of death, showing how families can bypass traditional funeral costs by honoring loved ones at home. Jack’s wish was for this film to inspire others, providing hope, and empowering viewers to make informed, meaningful choices for their own end-of-life journeys.
response.title: The Most Excellent Dying of Theodore Jack Heckelman
